meanings.definition: To create or write music or literary work.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys composing beautiful melodies on her piano.
meanings.sent2: The author spent hours composing a thrilling mystery novel.
meanings.sent3: While composing a song, he accidentally included the sound of a barking dog.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a symphony orchestra, each thought composing a different instrument.
meanings.sent5: The artist was deeply focused, composing a masterpiece with every stroke of the brush.

meanings.sent1: The chef is composing a delicious salad with fresh ingredients.
meanings.sent2: She is composing a collage using various pictures and textures.
meanings.sent3: Composing a puzzle, he realized a piece was missing, making him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together, each member composing a unique contribution to the project.
meanings.sent5: The architect was meticulously composing the blueprints for the new building.

meanings.definition: To be the parts or elements of.
meanings.sent1: Different colors and shapes are composing the beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent2: The diverse voices of the choir are composing a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent3: Composing the ingredients of the cake, she accidentally added salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky seem to be composing a celestial symphony.
meanings.sent5: The various spices are composing a flavorful blend in the stew.
